newsitem.title: USA: Clinton says no budget deal yet.
newsitem.headline: Clinton says no budget deal yet.

text.p: President Clinton said Wednesday that White House and congressional negotiators had not yet achieved an agreement on the budget but were still working hard to get one.
"Not yet," he told reporters when asked if there was a budget deal.
"We're working hard. We worked hard yesterday, and perhaps it will happen," he said.
Asked if he would be able to announce a deal before he leaves Monday on a trip to Mexico, Costa Rica and Barbados, Clinton was cautious. "Oh, I don't know about that," he said.
Clinton said the news that the Gross Domestic Product grew at a stronger-than-expected 5.6 percent annual rate in the first quarter was a "clear example" that his economic policies were working.
